		[3088] paragraph ''
			StaticText "With the world becoming data reliant, it's no surprise how data is the new gold. With the right data, you can improve peoples' lives, find solutions to problems and so on. There are many ways to capture peoples' data but on the web, forms are your go-to solution."
		[3089] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'Here are some practical tips on how to write accessible forms.'
		[3090] heading 'Always label your form inputs'
		[3092] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'Labels are a great way to get started with writing accessible forms. They are vital for helping people who use'
			[3093] link 'screen readers', url='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Screen_reader'
			StaticText 'and other kinds of assistive technology determine what label text go with what input field.'
		[3094] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'To associate a'
			[3095] code ''

			StaticText 'with an'
			[3096] code ''
				StaticText '<input>'
			StaticText ', set the identifier(ID) in the'
			[3097] code ''
				StaticText '<input>'
			StaticText 'to correspond with the'
			[3098] code ''
				StaticText 'for'
			StaticText 'attribute of the'
			[3099] code ''
				StaticText '<label>'
			StaticText '. This is the generally accepted approach.'

		[3165] heading 'Break long forms into smaller sections'
		[3167] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'Filling long forms can be stressful. This is largely true for almost everyone but particularity for people with'
			[3168] link 'AD/HD', url='https://www.cdc.gov/ncbddd/adhd/facts.html'
			StaticText '. Such forms can lead to an increase in'
			[3169] link 'Bounce rate', url='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bounce_rate'
			StaticText "which isn't what anyone wants. A simple solution is to break them into smaller sections. This helps make long forms less daunting and easier to understand as it is provided in bits."
		[3170] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'The following principles apply for multi-step forms:'
		[3171] list ''
			[3172] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'Repeat overall instruction on every page.'
			[3173] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'The forms should be split into logical groups.'
			[3174] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'The forms should inform the person about the progress thay are making.'
		[3175] paragraph ''
			[3176] strong ''
				StaticText 'Note:'
			StaticText 'There are no hard rules that defines a long form. However, you should consider if the form can be broken down into different logical sections.'
		[3177] heading 'Provide error messages'
		[3179] paragraph ''
			StaticText "When people encounter errors, they may need help to determine what's wrong and why. A common way forms indicate invalid fields is to change the"
			[3180] code ''
				StaticText '<input>'
			StaticText 'border color to red which is not ideal. The reason for this is because a change in color alone is not exposed to assistive technologies, so indicating errors in such ways will not inform the person of the error. Also, relying on color alone may also not work for someone who is red/green colorblind.'
		[3181] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'The following are ways to effectively and accessibly communicate form errors:'
		[3182] list ''
			[3183] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'Let the person know there is an error.'
			[3184] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'Let the person access the error, and provide instructions on how to fix it.'
			[3185] listitem ''
				ListMarker '•'
				StaticText 'Allow the person re-submit the form.'
		[3186] paragraph ''
			StaticText 'In the code below, there is an empty'
			[3187] link 'live region', url='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/ARIA_Live_Regions'
			StaticText 'which report errors to assistive technologies. Additionally, each field is followed by a'
			[3188] emphasis ''
				StaticText 'hint'
			StaticText 'which is hidden by default but shown if that field does not validate.'
